isis.stitle: Procedural Guideline - CRANKSHAFT DAMPER AND/OR FRONT SEAL; REPLACE

wtsproc.wtsdescrip: CRANKSHAFT DAMPER AND/OR FRONT SEAL; REPLACE
wtsproc.config: Vehicle has air conditioning, modulated fan clutch and manual transmission.

step1.para: Chock wheels.
Remove front bumper assembly.
Open hood.
Remove right side engine splash shield.
Drain air tanks. Close drain valves if applicable.
Remove both hood torsion bars. Disconnect hood wiring harness.
Disconnect hood stop cable. Close hood.
Remove hood pivot bolts. Remove hood assembly using two people.
Drain cooling system.
Remove charge air cooler hoses. Cap open ports.
Disconnect water heater hose from mount bracket at radiator. Secure out of way for access.
Disconnect air conditioning hose from fan shroud if applicable.
Disconnect air conditioning pressure transducer wiring if applicable.
Remove right recirculation shield.
Reposition air conditioning condenser from radiator frame and secure out of way.
Disconnect air line from modulated fan clutch if applicable.
Disconnect surge tank hoses necessary to remove cooling system with tank attached.
Disconnect low coolant level sensor wiring.
Disconnect ground strap from lower left side of radiator.
Disconnect radiator hose from thermostat housing.
Disconnect radiator hose from front cover.
Disconnect both lower radiator stay rods from cross member.
Remove radiator stone grill lower screws.
Remove frame cross member top section with grill attached.
Remove frame cross member lower section, include remove tow hooks.
Remove radiator assembly mounting bolts, remove assembly using lifting device.
Remove fan clutch air line fitting from clutch if applicable.

note.para: Step performed to allow fan blade removal from clutch.

step1.para: Remove fan blade from clutch.
Remove air conditioning belt if applicable.
Remove serpentine belt.
Remove crankshaft damper bolts and washer. Remove damper using puller.
Remove front crankshaft seal. Replace wear ring on damper using special tools.
Obtain heating iron for crankshaft damper. Mark hub of damper with thermomelt crayon (388 degrees F). Insert iron into damper.
Install front crankshaft seal.
Install crankshaft damper. Apply RTV to key way slot, torque bolts to spec.

note.para: Install damper when crayon melts using welding gloves. RTV applied to prevent oil seepage through key way.

step1.para: Install serpentine belt.
Install air conditioning belt if applicable.
Install fan blade, torque to spec. Install modulated fan clutch air line fitting if applicable.
Position radiator hose clamp (shrink type) onto hose that connects to front cover, prior to installing radiator assembly.
Install radiator assembly using lifting device. Install mounting bolts.
Connect both lower radiator stay rods to cross member.
Connect ground cable (strap) to radiator.
Connect radiator hose to thermostat housing and shrink clamp.
Shrink radiator hose clamp on hose connected to front cover.
Connect surge tank hoses.
Connect low coolant level sensor wiring.
Install right recirculation shield.
Connect air conditioning pressure transducer wiring if applicable.
Install frame cross member lower section, include install tow hooks.
Install frame cross member top section with grill attached.
Install radiator stone grill screws.
Install charge air cooler hoses.
Connect heater hose to mount bracket at radiator.
Connect air conditioning hose to fan shroud if applicable.
Fill cooling system.
Install hood assembly using two people. Install hood pivot bolts.
Connect both hood stop cables.
Install both hood torsion bars. Connect hood wiring harness.
Install front bumper assembly.
Top off fluids as needed.
Check engine for leaks.
Close hood / remove wheel chocks.
